Hasil Investigasi Lion Air JT 610 Keluar, Apa Tindak Lanjut Kemenhub?
01 Nov 2019, 04:10 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Konferensi Pers Ditjen Perhubungan Udara - Herdi Alif Alhikam

Jakarta - Hasil investigasi atas jatuhnya pesawat Lion Air PK-LQP pada Oktober 2018 telah diungkap oleh Komite Nasional Keselamatan Transportasi (KNKT). Setidaknya, ada 9 faktor yang berkontribusi terhadap tragedi ini.KNKT pun sudah bersurat dengan rekomendasi ke Kementerian Perhubungan, alamatnya ke Ditjen Perhubungan Udara. Lantas apa yang tindak lanjut Ditjen Perhubungan Udara?Dirjen Perhubungan Udara Polana Pramesti menyebutkan bahwa setidaknya ada tiga hal yang akan dilakukan Kemenhub. Pertama perbaikan prosedur SOP penerbangan, Polana akan melakukan integrasi dengan Kemenhub dan stakeholder termasuk maskapai."Kita akan tindak lanjuti KNKT, kita harus buat sesuatu dalam tiga bulan pertama. Kita akan memperbaiki manuals (prosedur) dari kita sendiri, antara manual satu dengan lainnya terjadi integrasi dan tidak saling bertentangan," ucap Polana di Kantor DKPPU, Bandara Soetta, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).Selain itu nantinya akan ada pelatihan terhadap pilot-pilot di Indonesia yang akan menggunakan Boeing 737 MAX 8 apabila mendapatkan izin terbang kembali. Pasalnya, nanti di MAX 8 sendiri akan ada fitur baru soal Safety Management Sytem (SMS)."Nanti ada juga terkait training kepada pilot ke operator untuk operasikan 737 MAX 8," ucap Polana.Terakhir, Polana menegaskan bahwa harus ada perbaikan hazard report alias pelaporan bahaya dari personel penerbangan kepada instansi dan pejabat terkait. Hal ini dilakukan agar penanganan pertama bisa cepat dilakukan dan dikoordinasikan."Kita juga akan memastikan hazard report yang disampaikan oleh personel benar-benar dapat diakses langsung oleh pejabat yang bertanggung jawab," ucap Polana. Lion Air JT 610 Investigation Out, What is the Follow Up of the Ministry of Transportation?
Nov 01 2019, 04:10 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Directorate General of Civil Aviation Press Conference - Herdi Alif Alhikam

Jakarta - The investigation results of the crash of the Lion Air PK-LQP in October 2018 have been revealed by the National Transportation Safety Committee (KNKT). At least, there are 9 factors that contributed to this tragedy. HCV also has written a recommendation to the Ministry of Transportation, the address is DGCA. So what is the follow up of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation? Director General of Civil Aviation Polana Pramesti said that there are at least three things that the Ministry of Transportation will do. First the improvement of the SOP procedures for the flight, Polana will integrate with the Ministry of Transportation and stakeholders including the airline. "We will follow up the NTSC, we have to make something in the first three months. We will improve the manuals (procedures) of our own, between manuals to one another occur integration and not conflicting, "said Polana at the DKPPU Office, Soetta Airport, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). In addition there will be training for pilots in Indonesia who will use the Boeing 737 MAX 8 if they get a flight permit. back. Because, later on MAX 8 itself there will be new features about the Safety Management System (SMS). "Later there will also be related training to pilots to operators to operate 737 MAX 8," said Polana. Finally, Polana stressed that there should be an improvement in hazard report alias Hazard reporting from flight personnel to relevant agencies and officials. This is done so that the first treatment can be quickly carried out and coordinated. "We will also ensure that hazard reports submitted by personnel are actually accessible directly by the responsible official," said Polana.
